intro: Tragacantha seytunensis, commonly known as the Seyedun thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant is known for its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny leaves, which provide protection against herbivores. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
